page.title: 08STONEHENGE POP FANS STOPPED
page.content: Early in 1985 the National Trust took civil action to stop the pop festival from taking place on their land around Stonehenge. During May police closed the A344 completely and visitors were only admitted via the eastern barrier. All fields adjacent to Stonehenge were ringed with razor wire and entrances blocked off. Notices bearing{"NO {UNAUTHORISED ENTRY"}were put up. Local residents had to detour and thus added extra mileage to their journeys. Soon it became clear that no one, especially the pop fans and travelling people would be allowed anywhere near the site of the proposed festival. Several attempts were made to gain access, resulting in skirmishes with the police and arrests were made. Eventually the Solstice passed and festival goers moved on to Westbury.
